name: The "Rich and Powerful"
description: "Our reputation is.... easily reversible." knuckle crack

name: Silent Killer
description: Use Silencer to pay for Dagger, Data Sucker for Power Shutdown recover or blocks removing a Silencer

name: HB Super Friends
description: Caprice + Ash + Some ice makes people give up on running a server, Haas makes scoring faster once they give up

name: HB plays a fair game
Gruul Ramp
description: Uses 1 Core + the Genesis cycle. This is a slow Criminal deck that does not want to get tagged. It tries to get a second link and play Underworld Contact ASAP to generate lots of money. Then it can use ticks to draw as almost everything in the deck can be played immediately, building up to a few big turns where you break through ice and then derez it to make your subsequent runs easier, and use mediums to find the last few agendas in R&D to steal.

name: Breakerbuster Weyland final
description:
This is a final draft of the deck I had been playing for 2 months. In this final version I've added PGO to kill plascretes, since plascrete really put a stop to the punitive plan, with just 1 plascrete the runner can steal a 3 pointer and keep their grip full and be totally safe (without the cleaners).

The idea was to break off whatever breaker you can with grim and archer troubleshooted. I've switched grims for roto turrets in this version, added ash and removed blue level. Blue level was fantastic in the deck for finding combo pieces, but I didn't need the money, and it would sometimes overdraw agendas (with 3 pointers its bad).

I use the big agendas to capitalize on scoring windows, you need only score 2 agendas out of the remotes.

Punitive works very well, esp if the runner makes a double or triple R&D dig and scores 6 or 4 points. With less draw I'm not sure how effective it'll be (BLC really helped find these moving parts), but I think it'll still be fine as is.

Agg Sec blows away breakers very well (at the Indy store champs I killed at least 10 programs, including every last breaker 1 criminal player had). Once you've scored a 3 pointer, aggsec does work.

Hive is a decent add for early protection, since you're not scoring many points before the game ends.

The big piles of cash also scare the runner with the looming threat of sea source scorch, so there is minor bluff factor in that.

I've given up on this for the time being so I thought I'd share it out. The previous iteration had 3 BLC and 0 ash, and 2 grim and 0 rototurret. Also 0 PGO.

name: Plan A: FA (v1.2)
description:
Updated with Double Time.

Plan A: Set up a scoring remote with Hive plus one other ice (preferably Chum) and score the first Medical Breakthrough ASAP. From there, you can use Mushin No Shin with Plan B, Junebug, agendas, and/or Trick of Light to keep the scoring going. You only need to score 3 agendas to win, so if the Runner ignores your Mushin No Shin on a Plan B, use it as a bank to Trick out a 3/2 or another Medical Breakthrough.

Agendas: NAPD Contract comes in over Nisei Mk II to provide some draining capability. Like Character Assassination in NBN FA, it's the agenda you generally don't want to draw.

Ice mix: Hive, Guard, Quandary, and Chimera pretty much guarantee you've covered your bases and that the Runner will have to install a full set of breakers. Chum in front of a Hive on your scoring remote should buy you a nice long scoring window, and even better, it still has 1 subroutine when you're at match point.

Economy: Beanstalk + Hedge + Gift with Jackson Howard to draw up should be plenty in a deck where the most expensive rez cost is 5c for Hive. Caprice is a credit drain, but at worst she'll be on par with Biotics and SanSans in NBN FA.

Will o' the Wisp is a likely future addition as a way to open additional scoring windows and delay R&D lock.

name: Already Seen Scumbag (Six Feet Under Games, Store Championsh
description:
Store Championship Gabe deck, based off of Martin Presley's Scumbag Tactics.

Tournament report here: http://boardgamegeek.com/article/15377245

name: Pay to Play (Six Feet Under Games, Store Championship Winner
description:
Store Championship Making News deck, based off of Lluluien's Never Advance.

Tournament report here: http://boardgamegeek.com/article/15377245

name: Jinteki Replicating Perfection
Kate Hardware
description:
Uses Replicator to thin the deck of hardware quickly. 7 MU + Yogasaurus allows for both Magnum and Paintbrush to run at the same time, and a single Clone Chip + SMC allows me to pull out four programs for $8.

Personal Workshop saves me from have to discard the extra hardware. Suggestions appreciated.

name: Kate Hardware
description:
Uses Replicator to thin the deck of hardware quickly. 7 MU + Yogasaurus allows for both Magnum and Paintbrush to run at the same time, and a single Clone Chip + SMC allows me to pull out four programs for $8.

Personal Workshop saves me from have to discard the extra hardware.

Personal Workshop saves me from have to discard the extra hardware.

name: Building A Better Boom
GRNDL (Taipei, Taiwan 2014 S1 Champion)
Medium+Guard (Taipei, Taiwan 2014 S1 Champion)
Paywall
description:
Explanation of essentially everything below!

Paywall is my personal variation of the "Red Coats" deck that intends to tax the runner with big ice and protect agendas with Ash.

Eli + quandary + roto and even Viktor are your "cheap ice" ETR options for earlier rushing of agendas.

Heimdalls + Tollbooth + Wotan + Ichis and Viktor will tax the runner on credits and make for expensive additions to your super server.

Ash is straightforward, protects agendas after forcing expensive runs. Also good on R&D occasionally to protect against deep digs.

GRNDL is a real winner here. Either bait expensive runs or make big credits to afford your huge ice. I've managed to score 6x advanced GRNDLs but I wouldn't honestly recommend it. At most I might install and advance 1-2 times to bait the runner. You don't want to overadvance and lose it. Sure, you bait an expensive run but you're also overextending. 1-2 for the bait and if it fails, then next turn advance 2 times and trash for credit returns.

Adonis + PAD net you money but essentially function as distractions. They make the runner spend to trash (outside of that annoying Whizzard character).

Possible swaps based on preference: -3x PAD for +3 Eve campaign. -1x Restructure +1 GRNDL Refinery or +1 Subliminal Messaging -3x Accelerated Beta Test +3x NAPD Contract (NAPD Contract IS awesome in this deck)

It's all about timing. You DO run the risk of losing big agendas in HQ and R&D so be mindful of that. I've had issues where I forget to protect those areas a little harder while I build my super server. Don't forget to protect archives a bit against Criminals and Noise.

name: Development Hell 6.0
description:
This is the corp deck I took to the Store Championships 2014 in Jenkintown, PA at 7th Dimension Games.

While I got crushed runner side, I didn't give up a single Corp game that day.

Use hedge + pad + adonis to make cash (or tax runner when they trash).

Use biotic + trick of light to score agendas out of hand. Jackson + archived memories + overadvanced vitruvius can get them back as necessary.

Jackson can do so much here - accelerate your deck, protect agendas in archives, retrieve money assets + fast advance options, or function as accelerated beta test insurance. The usual.

Aggressive secretary functions as your TOL bank, but if you can bait someone into it, it will help things tremendously.

Ice is personal preference and a lot of 1x to vary it up. There might be better options here so experiment.

The only diff. between the deck I took to the store and this is -1x archived and +1x subliminal.

I would also consider running 1x archived memories and 2x Rework. Reworks function is obvious - can't score out of hand? Shuffle it back into your well protected R&D.

name: Jinteki Replicating Perfection
Turning out the Lights.
description:
So I'm still not sure on my ICE suite, but the idea of the shell-game of Jinteki (even if you never use it, it's the implied threat) combined with the trickle economy of Sundew and lots of low costed, but reasonable ICE seems like a good idea. Get the runner to commit early and break their toys with Power Shutdown.

Thoughts? Any major faux pas here?

Thanks

name: Accelerated Shipment from Hand v2
description:
Update: A New Version posted with a few updates.

Up Front -- this is a cheese deck, and although not completely competitive, it can win enough. If this has been done before, I apologize for not giving credit where credit is due. The idea here is to win outright from your hand with a multiple variations of an 8-12 card combo and 4-13 credits.

Edits from v1: Removed Panic Button, added a 3rd Biotic Labor and 3 more ICE.

First up, I want to highlight what PeekaySK has pointed out already in the excellent writeup in his Cerebral Giraffes deck--that is that Blue Level Clearance ramps up the Cererbral Imaging identity greatly.

Its pretty basic on strategy, massive draw potential, and the X-level clearances help keep your credit pool about where it needs to be. You're driving at a core set of cards in hand:

  • Power Shutdown
  • Accelerated Diagnostics
  • 3 Agendas (one being a 5/3)

Supplemented to this, although not explicitly required is:

  • Biotic Labor
  • Archived Memories
  • Shipment from Kaguya

There are so many win combinations, is it mind boggling. It will take 8-12 cards, and 3-13 credits for the bulk of the win conditions. The trick is figuring it out.

Backing up:
You want to draw -- draw as much as you can. Use the X-level clearances, the Anonymous Tips, and even Jackson Howard, although NEVER remove him from the game. You don't even need the Hedge Fund so much, so just hold them to recover from Siphon.

The trickiest part of this is that you actually WANT to discard some of the cards (Shipment from SanSan priarily, others conditionally). To do this, you want to be careful about keeping hand and credits about the same.

ICE selection is just meant to be a spread, and cheap to rez. They don't really stop for long, just slow down hopefully. Pick whatever you like, but keep it cheap.

Combo up: Now solve the puzzle. When can you win outright from your hand? You'll need minimum of 8 cards in many combinations. The only card you absolutely need is Power Shutdown, and it sure helps to have Jackson Howard and Accelerated Diagnostics. The next thing you're looking for is one of each agenda. You can make it work with as little as one, but its trickier.

First an example:

  1. Power Shutdown
  2. Biotic Labor
  3. Install Jackson Howard (burn him to seed the Accelerated Diagnostics)
  4. Accelerated Diagnostics - Shipment from MirrorMorph (1 of each agenda), Shipment from SanSan x2 (Score Efficiency Committee +3 clicks)
  5. Archived Memories (Jackson Howard)
  6. Install Jackson Howard (burn to seed Accelerated Diagnostics)
  7. Accelerated Diagnostics - Shipment from SanSan x3
  8. Shipment from Kaguya

Count 'em: 10 cards from hand, 8 credits.

If you are scoring through an Efficiency Committee you need to fire off 6 of the advancing shipments, with at least 1 being a Shipment from Kaguya. This gets you 12 advancment tokens to spread on 3 agendas. The reason one needs to be a Shipment from Kaguya is because you need to finish off the odd numbered agendas.

There are MANY ways to win--the challenge is in figuring out the puzzle. Total number of clicks is 15: 12 (advances), 3 (installs). So the puzzle is in getting those extra 12 clicks to get up to 15, and there are many ways. Primarily, the Accelerated Diagnostics gains +5 clicks if you use it with 3 double cards. However, it cost a click for Power shutdown, and a click to install Jackson Howard so the first Accelerated Diagnostics will net you at most +3 clicks. Being as Power Shutdown only needs to fire once, the 2nd Accelerated Diagnostics can gain you 4 more. Shipment from Mirrormorph gains you 2 clicks, Efficiency Committee gains 3 more, and Shipment from Kaguya gains 1 click.

  • Accelerated Diagnostics x2 (7 clicks)
  • Efficiency Committee (3 clicks)
  • Shipment from MirrorMorph (2 clicks)
  • Shipment from Kaguya (1 click)

Total: 16 (adding the 3 normal clicks)

Easy right? There is even a spare click there to Archived Memories up something we need. Well -- not so easy. 2 reasons:

  1. You do not always have all the cards you need, and so you have to make concessions from the optimal path, which is using all Shipment from SanSan with your Accelerated Diagnostics.
  2. When the clicks are used is extremely important. You don't get an advance up-front on them all, and you have to generate as you go.

Once you have the base math in your head, you can begin to recognize when its go-time. If you don't have a card you need in hand, then add a click to sub a wild card (Archived Memories). Compensate with Biotic Labor for each of these needed. If you have a 2nd Vitrivius in place of an Efficiency Committee you can either A. add a click (i.e. one less advance needed), or B. add a click (over-advance and one less Archived Memories to play). Not using Efficiency Committee then only loses you 2 clicks, which can be purchased for 8 credits with Biotic Labor x2.

  • +1 click if your opponent leaves a Jackson Howard on the table for you.
  • +4 clicks if you go through a 3rd Accelerated Diagnostics. Although typically you only do this in trickier combos.
  • -1 clicks when you play a non-double with Accelerated Diagnostics.
  • -1 click to "find" a card in archives with Archived Memories or Interns.

Scenario: In your hand is a Power Shutdown, Jackson Howard, Accelerated Diagnostics x2, 1 of each agenda, and Archived Memories x2. Doing the base math that is +7 for the 2 Accelerated Diagnostics and +3 for the Efficiency Committee. If we burn one of our Archived Memories for a third Accelerated Diagnostics then we'll get another +3. Total of 13, so it looks good. Its at least worth thinking about now, but the first hurdle is making sure you can score your Efficiency Committee with a click to spare to harvest the clicks. It would go something like this:

  • Power Shutdown
  • Install Jackson Howard

Pausing here for a moment. We need a Shipment from MirrorMorph to save clicks before we can get the Efficiency Committee scored so we're going to need to use 1 of the Accelerated Diagnostics slots on Shipment from MirrorMorph to install the Efficiency Committee. If we were to Shipment from SanSan x2 for the next 2 Accelerated Diagnostics slots to score an Efficiency Committee then we don't have a click left to harvest our Efficiency Committee clicks. So we're going to need to aim at our 2nd Accelerated Diagnostics to score the Efficiency Committee. We'll need to gain a couple more clicks with Biotic to get there, so add that to the Accelerated Diagnostics mix. Finally, we need to get another Jackson Howard out anyway, so lets use the last Accelerated Diagnostics slot for an Interns. We will fit in Shipment from SanSan x5 into the next 2 Accelerated Diagnostics, but first lets get that Efficiency Committee scored.

  • Accelerated Diagnostics - Shipment from MirrorMorph (3 Agendas), Interns (Jackson Howard), Biotic Labor

Next click we'll use the Accelerated Diagnostics to score the Efficiency Committee, and Interns for Jackson Howard to setup for the 3rd Accelerated Diagnostics that is not yet in hand.

  • Accelerated Diagnostics - Shipment from SanSan x2, Interns (Jackson Howard) (Score Efficiency Committee)

Whew, click relief now with that Efficiency Committee, we're well on our way. Utilize those 2 wild cards (Archives Memories) to dig a Shipment from Kaguya and an Accelerated Diagnostics from archives and finish it off.

  • Archived Memories - Accelerated Diagnostics
  • Archived Memories - Shipment from Kaguya
  • Accelerated Diagnostics - Shipment from SanSan x3
  • Shipment from Kaguya

Checking our math, 8 full clicks used. +3 for Efficiency Committee, +2 for Biotic, +3 starting.

Count 'em: 9 cards from hand, 9 credits used.

This is just one scenario, and its more complicated than you know to figure it out in the middle of a game where your opponent is not going to let you take 10 minutes to puzzle it out. It can work with only 2 agendas in hand. It can work with zero Jackson Howards in hand (or table). It can work without using Efficiency Committee. You just need to solve the puzzle :)

Looking Ahead:

  • Quandry in place of NEXT Bronze to save a credit.
  • No Panic Button on purpose. Not because of money, but because it takes a click to install and also its a trashable card for the runner to help dig R&D.
  • Reclamation Orders on first glance seems good, but there are surprisingly few combos that would benefit from it.

The primary thing here is that the deck draws so darned fast, that it does not actually take you that long to setup. The primary hurt is the Anarch suite: Medium, Nerve Agent, Imp, and Vamp. I can usually soak one Siphon, but most Siphon decks are geared to do more than one and then it hurts.

This is not as competitive as PeeKaySK's version, but it sure is fun to potentially be at a winning state from nothing in any given turn after the 4th or 5th (usually 9 or 10).

Tag n Bag

still kept it at 40 cards.

name: DARWIN-KNIGHT V4
Weyland UofMCSSA Round3
description: GRNDL: Power Unleashed - Larry 2-1 Larry vs Eli (Gabriel Santiago)

name: Choose Your Own Death v0.1
Tracy First Runner Build
description: First build up to What Lies Ahead

name: Dino Ninja Attack
TrayTray First Corp Build
description: First build on Corp - up to What lies Ahead

name: Runaround
description:
Originally based on http://netrunner.meteor.com/decks/ujH5Jb3hmhdodcYDF and then modified.

Pretty basic. Idea is to get voice pads down, then play at least one event for free each turn using them. Also gives you bigger money swings from Sure Gamble and Dirty Laundry which is nice. Draw through the deck, get your icebreakers out, then hammer R&D. Use Levy to get the events back and run them again.

I took it to a small tournament in Fremont and did ok. Main trick is knowing when to Levy, if youve used up most of your econ cards and don't have Magnum Opus out yet you probably need to reshuffle. Works great against Jinteki since you just draw a ton of cards before running and shrug off the damage.

Currently working on a new version that uses Chaos Theory to be able to run through quicker and adds Lucky Find to get more event-based money (removing SMCs and MO). We'll see how it works

name: Kit - One Ice Breaker Deck
description: I was inspired to create a deck that ran one ice breaker, with one copy of it. Do you think it can work? When Paintbrush comes out, it will replace Tinkering, and be more consistent. Same Old Thing can be used to bring back Torch through Test Run if it gets destroyed, otherwise Account Siphon a couple of times more. Also once the Plascretes come out, floating tags is no big deal. Although I've been flatlined plenty of times with only one out.

name: Field Reporting
description:
//From WICU, News Channel 122.342, this is iWitnessed News. Information that matters, as it happens//

✑Other news teams give you gimmicks and graphics, but we don't have to write on the moon to bring you the information you need.

In tonight's top story, Lead ChiLo Security Infrastructure Analyst Lois Mackenzie has reported that despite a string of highly-publicized attacks on the ChiLo megalopolis's key systems, no significant damage or loss has been incurred. Mackenzie credited the city's success and resilience to key investments in foreign encryption products as well as increased spending in anti-terrorist infrastructure.

"Our streamlined, tailored collection of information about this city's most dangerous miscreants has saved countless lives and billions of credits of taxpayer money. And we will work tirelessly to expand our security infrastructure to ensure that the good people of ChiLo are insulated from the lawlessness that rules on other grids."

Mackenzie concluded her remarks by introducing a new initiative: she plans to remove old, vulnerable infrastructure chokepoints that have been a key attack vector for cybercriminals. ChiLo will begin this series of demolition efforts later this month.

Now to Linda with the weather.

name: Deep Corp 3/22/2014
Exile Alpha and Omega
description:
This deck uses crescentus and false echo to make the outermost ice go away, and thus turn on alpha for the next ice you encounter. If you can recur these enough times, it should be easy to keep the corp at 2 layers of ice, making Alpha and omega all you need. If that fails datasucker and parasite do work. With alpha and omega up, its super tough for the corp to lock you out of suckers, with toolbox in play you can easily pay for most runs on 1 central to get your suckers going again.

Lucky find is there for that sudden burst econ, and to help you have that or SG in hand early since the early game is so important. This deck can go tag me. If you don't feel the need to go tag me, then maybe procontacts is a better add than mopus, unsure...but usually rig building thrives on Daily casts and pro contacts... Thoughts?

name: WYLD: GRNDL (4th at Comix City Too! Store Championship Nashv
description: This deck's main objective is to rush agendas early game to get points on the board (especially Atlas) before the runner can set up and punish those who get tunnel vision with low credits. It's primary mode of winning is by points with Scorch as more of a secondary option if possible. GRNDL is new enough to instill fear into those who haven't taken the time to research and play test this ID for themselves and the negative of bad pub can be cleared with the help of Double Time's Witness Tampering. Rez Archer and Grim in front of initial ICE to surprise runners and trash their programs along with Power Shutdown to get rid of those pesky SMCs, Datasucker, Parasite, Corroder, etc. If you find yourself in a sticky situation and need to resort to Scorching there are three ways to tag with this deck: Snare, SEA Source, and Posted Bounty. Project Atlas is the star in the deck when over scored early game which enables you to grab that missing Scorch component at crucial moments which catch the runner off guard.

name: ANDROMEDA (4th at Comix City too! Store Championship Nashvil
description: Pretty much your standard Andy+Datasucker build with some slight modifications to help in certain scenarios. I decided to add an HQ Interface to help against Fast Advance and the up and coming but very powerful Cerebral Imaging decks. I have to say the addition of Mr. Li and a third copy of Desperado really made the difference with this versus previous versions I play tested. Installing Desperado from your opening hand can make the difference between pinching credits and rolling in the money and Mr. Li helps tremendously for card pull when Pro Contacts is trashed or just too expensive. Best part is the cards you put at the bottom of your stack with Li can be resurfaced with a Special Order or two when looking for breakers to install. All in all Andromeda has been and still is a front runner (no pun intended) against just about every corp that stands in her way!

name: Ken like Pikenchu
Ken like Pikenchu 4.2.14
False Patriarchy
description: What? You've never been made a fool by a beautiful woman before?

name: 4.2.0.VIRUS_RUN+
Untrashable 54
description: I wanted to try db0 Untrashable v5 deck but with Caprice. So I added one more NAPD and Shinodi. After play testing it 2 times not sure I like the feel of it with 5 more cards.

name: NEXT Rush'n Attack 1.0
description:
I'd like a little help with this deck if you don't mind. I based it off of the idea's proposed in: http://thesatelliteuplink.blogspot.com/2014/02/shields-up-understanding-ice.html

The idea is: Rushing out agenda's as fast as possible, possibly triggering ABT's pushing you way into a mid-game state, and destroying breakers on the way. Rezing an inopportune Grim, or a well timed Ichi can take out those breakers. Use power shutdown to take out corroders, or even SMC's to prevent them from even arriving. I tend to lose as I get into a mid-game state ... as you might imagine. I like mandatory upgrades, as it extends the life of Aggressive Secretaries past install adv adv. I may be wrong, and should just replace them with NAPD contracts.
